meanings.definition: A type of wooden siding consisting of long, overlapping boards.
meanings.sent1: The old house had beautiful clapboarding on its exterior walls.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter installed new clapboarding on the house to protect it from the weather.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the clapboarding as a ladder to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The clapboarding on the house was like a shield, guarding it from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind against the clapboarding was a soothing lullaby at night.

meanings.definition: The act of covering a building with clapboards.
meanings.sent1: The clapboarding of the barn was done by skilled craftsmen.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the repair crew started the clapboarding of the damaged house.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were clapboarding a giant castle made of cardboard boxes.
meanings.sent4: The clapboarding of the church symbolized a fresh start for the community.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of clapboarding echoed through the quiet neighborhood.
